name: Iousbhiddriver-descriptor-override
tagline: Fork of Google Code project with support for the Noppoo Choc Mini
body: IOUSBHIDDriverDescriptorOverride ================================ This OS X kernel extension provides a method for overriding a HID descriptor and ignoring the descriptor provided by the device. This is useful when the HID descriptor returned by a HID device is invalid or incorrect. For more details and troubleshooting, please see the [project on github][github]. [github]: https://github.com/thefloweringash/iousbhiddriver-descriptor-override Installation ------------ 1. Install [the latest version][latest]. 2. Install [KeyRemap4MacBook] 3. Reboot [keyremap4macbook]: http://pqrs.org/macosx/keyremap4macbook/ [latest]: http://thefloweringash.com/iousbhiddriver-descriptor-override/downloads/IOUSBHIDDriverDescriptorOverride-2013-03-01-5e3d79c.pkg Supported Devices ----------------- * Noppoo Choc Mini (1006:0022, 1007:8400) * Noppoo Choc Pro (04f3:5a5a) Including the support from the [original project](#acknowledgements) for * Griffin PowerMate * Macally iShock Acknowledgements ------------------------------------------------ This project is a fork of the [Google Code project of the same name][google-code-project], and has been extended to handle issues with the Noppoo Choc Mini and Noppoo Choc Pro. [google-code-project]: http://code.google.com/p/iousbhiddriver-descriptor-override/
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
